snippet: The jobs report combined with improving statistics on construction spending, manufacturing and consumer sentiment to ease fears that the recovery was flagging.
abstract: Labor Department reports that job growth accelerated faster than originally estimated at the end of 2012, continuing at a steady if modest pace in January, with employers adding 157,000 payroll positions; notes that, even with positive growth, the unemployment rate ticked up to 7.9 percent.
lead_paragraph: The jobs report combined with improving statistics on construction spending, manufacturing and consumer sentiment to ease fears that the recovery was flagging.

headline.main: Job Growth Steady, but Unemployment Rises to 7.9%
headline.print_headline: Job Growth Still Steady, But Rate Rises to 7.9%
